value.title: RLS with TWO Fact tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you struggled with using Row-Level Security (RLS) on a dimension connected to two fact tables? Patrick looks at some options you can use to accomplish this in Power BI.  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop.  Gilbert Q's Blog: https://www.fourmoo.com/2020/04/22/how-to-refresh-selected-not-all-tables-in-power-bi-desktop/  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Why isn't my Agg hitting when using DISTINCTCOUNT in Power BI???

Get ready for some DAX fusion!  DAX Fusion: https://dax.tips/2019/08/05/dax-fusion/  Aggregations Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/transform-model/aggregations-advanced

value.title: Working with images in Power BI

This looks at how you can integrate visuals in your visuals based on your data.  LET'S CONNECT! value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present
